Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph
  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a simple directed graph with weighted edges. There are no negative cycles, and edges are allowed to be negatively weighted.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Graph()
      Constructs an empty graph with no nodes
      Graph​(int numberOfNodes)
      Constructs a graph with numberOfNodes nodes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addEdge​(int from, int to, int weight)
      Adds a directed edge from the from node to the to with a weight of weight
      void addNode()
      Allocates sufficient space for one additional node in the graph
      void addNodes​(int numberOfNodes)
      Allocates sufficient space for the given number of nodes in the graph
      java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> getIncomingEdges​(int to)
      Obtains a copy of the list of all edges arriving at the given node
      int getNumberOfNodes()
      Obtains the current number of nodes in the graph
      java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> getOutgoingEdges​(int from)
      Obtains a copy of the list of all edges leaving the given node

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Constructs an empty graph with no nodes

      • Graph

        public Graph​(int numberOfNodes)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a graph with numberOfNodes nodes. This simply allocates sufficient memory for the specified number of nodes
        Parameters:
        numberOfNodes - The initial number of nodes in the graph
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given number of nodes is negative

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfNodes

        public int getNumberOfNodes()
        Obtains the current number of nodes in the graph
        Returns:
        The current number of nodes in the graph

      • addNode

        public void addNode()
        Allocates sufficient space for one additional node in the graph

      • addNodes

        public void addNodes​(int numberOfNodes)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Allocates sufficient space for the given number of nodes in the graph
        Parameters:
        numberOfNodes - The number of nodes to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of nodes to be added is not positive

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge​(int from,
                    int to,
                    int weight)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a directed edge from the from node to the to with a weight of weight
        Parameters:
        from - The integer representing the node the edge comes from
        to - The integer representing the node the edges goes to
        weight - The weight of the edge
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either node is not contained in the graph, or if there already exists an edge from the from node to the to node

      • getOutgoingEdges

        public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> getOutgoingEdges​(int from)
                                                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Obtains a copy of the list of all edges leaving the given node
        Parameters:
        from - The integer representing the node whose outgoing edges we want
        Returns:
        A copy of the list of all edges leaving the given node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given node is not contained in the graph

      • getIncomingEdges

        public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> getIncomingEdges​(int to)
                                                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Obtains a copy of the list of all edges arriving at the given node
        Parameters:
        to - The integer representing the node whose incoming edges we want
        Returns:
        A copy of the list of all edges arriving the given node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given node is not contained in the graph
